title: Uncertainty looms over Devil release after actor Darshan’s arrest
content: The release of the first song from the actor’s upcoming film Devil was postponed soon after his arrest

title: Bengaluru’s streets painted in hues of the tricolour for I-Day
content: The merchandise has evolved along with pin-on badges, little flags, and Gandhi topis. People today look for LED-lit wristbands, scrunchies, and phone covers, according to shopkeepers who see the season as the best for their businesses

title: Police sound alert in low-lying villages as Krishna flood level rises
content: Overflowing Kattaleru and other streams disrupt vehicular movement between A.P. and Telangana for some time

title: HC quashes proceedings on ‘negative comments’ in  Whatsapp group about CMDRF account

title: BRS flays hike in life tax on vehicles, says it’s heavy burden on middle-class, poor
content: Harish Rao says it’d result in over ₹1,000 cr burden on people annually in addition to HAM model of road maintenance contracts

title: Duration of the CSE exam cannot be curtailed, the UPSC says
content: A parliamentary panel had recommended a comprehensive re-examination of the civil services recruitment framework, stressing that the process be rationalised and streamlined

title: Violence marks ‘Partition horrors day’
content: Clashes break out at University of Calicut, Government Law College in Kozhikode, Government College in Kasaragod after Sangh Parivar outfits try to observe day as directed by Governor

title: First warning in force, heavy flooding persists at Prakasam Barrage
content: Major reservoirs in State hold 732.92 tmcft of water, 80.68% of their gross capacity, while medium reservoirs record a storage of 49%

title: Bill amending Uttarakhand anti-conversion Act includes prison sentences ranging from three years to life term
content: The State Cabinet approved wide-ranging provisions in the more stringent Freedom of Religion (Amendment) Bill, 2025, with ‘allurement’ defined as ‘any gift, gratification, easy money or material benefit, whether in cash or kind, employment, or by invoking divine displeasure’

title: Madras High Court orders release of arrested lawyers, law students during GCC conservancy workers’ protests
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan restrain the six individuals from giving interviews to the media or posting messages on social media, regarding the protest and the arrest, till February 21, 2025

title: Kerala HC terms right to motorable roads as a Constitutional right, seeks safety and quality audit report within a month
content: Although the court had earlier sought a comprehensive audit report on road safety and quality from the Public Works department and the Kochi Corporation, the government’s counsel sought additional time to submit it

title: Chennai has 1.8 lakh stray dogs: Corporation tells Madras High Court
content: Greater Chennai Corporation says 10 more ABC centres are being established and that it has already begun ‘Rabies-free Chennai’ programme aimed at vaccinating both pets as well as strays in all 15 zones within 60 days

title: Govt. exploring ways to revive APHMEL, says Telangana Deputy CM Bhatti Vikramarka
content: A consultancy will soon be constituted to submit a report on the company and decide on the future course of action, he says

title: Heavy rain leaves houses flooded in Guntur’s Murikipeta; officials take up relief work
content: Municipal authorities arrange drinking water, food for affected residents; Commissioner promises permanent solution to check flooding

title: Vigilance judge rules Chief Minister has no legal standing to interfere in anti-corruption inquiries
content: Court slams the VACB’s contention that its legally disputed preliminary inquiry report exculpating former Additional Director General of Police, Law and Order, M R Ajith Kumar, from charges of illegal amassment of wealth, had the Chief Minister’s approval. The judge stated that the VACB’s testimony had no standing in a court of law and contravened the basic principles of jurisprudence

title: CM, Governor and Opposition leader extend Independence Day greetings
content: Reactionary forces are trying to distort nationalism, which is based on secularism, communal amity and coexistence and create division among people, says Pinarayi

title: Watch: What’s happening to Tamil Nadu’s plans for newer airports? | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: In this episode, let’s see how Tamil Nadu is redrawing its aviation map, from small towns like Rameswaram to industrial hubs like Hosur, with a big push for new airports.

content: Bhatti Vikramarka says the steps would be taken for development of APHMEL during visit to plant near Ibrahimpatnam in AP

title: Kolinji to join GI-tag awaiting products from Kerala
content: Alpinia galanga is widely cultivated in parts of Pathanamthitta, Kottayam and Idukki and has many applications in traditional medicines

title: Socially banished, many suffer  human and civil rights violations in silence

Sudhi speaks to some of the alleged victims of the social exclusionary practices to learn about their plight and the situations that reportedly culminated in human and civil rights violations of individuals

title: Online seminar held at Cusat to mark ‘Partition Horror Day’
content: The Kerala government had informed universities and affiliated colleges that observing ‘Partition Horror Day’ was not mandatory

title: I don’t see any reason for me to contest outside of NDA: Chirag Paswan

title: Supreme Court order on SIR is a massive victory for democracy: Congress

title: Dhanlaxmi Bank, NSIC ink pact to enhance credit facilitation for MSMEs

title: Master plan unveiled for expansion of Technopark Phase IV in Thiruvananthapuram

title: Whistle-blower doctor Haris Chirackal replies to show-cause notice

title: Special Economic Zone for electronics sanctioned in Dharwad, says Joshi
content: A Central gazette notification says that 28 acres have been earmarked at the Hubballi Durable Goods Cluster for the proposed electronics units

title: Wild elephants killed 97 people in three years in Karnataka, says Khandre
content: Environment and Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre informed the Legislative Assembly that wild elephants have trampled to death 97 people in the State during the last three years. The government has paid ₹13.65 crore as compensation

title: How do teams approach training camp with a rookie quarterback?
content: new coach Dan Quinn wanted to make sure the situation was right . Quinn spent time analyzing what he'd do differently the next time . he hadn't built his coaching staff to withstand success . the team went to the super bowl in the 2016 season .

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: '25% chance meeting will …': Trump teases outcome of talks with Putin; hints at bigger showdown
content: Donald Trump envisions a three-way summit with Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskyy to finalize a Ukraine peace deal, following his Alaska meeting with Putin on August 15. Trump acknowledged a 25% chance of the Alaska summit being unsuccessful, emphasizing its role in setting the stage for future negotiations.

title: 'Don't make emotional decisions': Sehwag reveals Sachin stopped him from retirement in 2008
content: Virender Sehwag considered retiring from ODIs in 2007-08 after being dropped, but Sachin Tendulkar advised him to reconsider, drawing from his own experience. Sehwag heeded the advice, returned to form, and played a vital role in India's 2011 World Cup victory. He also shared his thoughts on his son Aryaveer's cricket career, emphasizing the importance of handling pressure.

title: Tree fall, wall collapse: Delhi rain havoc claims 3 lives in 12 hours
content: Heavy rains in Delhi caused havoc, resulting in three deaths within 12 hours. Two boys died in Vasant Vihar after a wall collapsed, while a man was killed in Kalkaji when a tree fell on his motorcycle. AAP leader Atishi demanded the resignation of PWD Minister Parvesh Verma, blaming the BJP government for inadequate monsoon preparations and rising rain-related fatalities.

title: Rohit Sharma back on the field, gears up for ODI comeback - WATCH
content: Rohit Sharma is intensely training for an ODI comeback, aiming to play until the 2027 World Cup. A video shows him in excellent form, coinciding with his rise to No. 2 in the ICC ODI batting rankings. Sharma and Kohli, committed to the 50-over format, may return in the October series against Australia.

title: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke: Won’t allow employees to refuse using GitHub
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke mandated the use of the platform for all employees, emphasizing its integral role in the company culture. Under his leadership, GitHub experienced significant growth, particularly with AI-powered development tools like GitHub Copilot. However, Dohmke has recently resigned to pursue entrepreneurial ventures, leading to GitHub's integration into Microsoft's CoreAI team by the end of 2025.

title: Trump sees 'dead economy' - but S&P upgrades India's credit rating; here's why
content: S&P Global upgraded India's rating to 'BBB' citing buoyant economic growth and enhanced monetary policy. Despite US tariffs, India's economy remains resilient due to domestic consumption and manageable impact on exports. The upgrade reflects India's strong recovery from the pandemic, infrastructure investments, and stable inflation, supporting long-term growth prospects.

title: 85+ Happy Independence Day messages, greetings, wishes and quotes for 2025
content: India will celebrate Independence Day on August 15, 2025. The day honors freedom fighters' sacrifices. People share wishes with family and friends. Messages reflect freedom and national pride. Celebrations include patriotic songs and flag hoisting. Citizens pledge to protect unity. The day promotes love for the nation. It encourages remembering the past and dreaming of tomorrow. Jai Hind

title: After injury vs India, England pacer gives a big update ahead of Ashes
content: England's Chris Woakes is optimistic about his Ashes participation after a dislocated shoulder sustained during the India Test. His rehabilitation is progressing well, allowing him to move his arm without a sling. Woakes aims to strengthen his shoulder through rehab, hoping to avoid surgery and be fit for the series against Australia starting in November.

title: Sundar Pichai on AI: ‘It will create more jobs than it destroys'
content: Amidst job displacement concerns due to AI, Google CEO Sundar Pichai argues that technology historically creates more opportunities than it eliminates. He emphasizes the need for upskilling and reskilling initiatives to prepare the workforce for AI-driven roles. Pichai also calls for ethical AI regulations, highlighting the importance of human skills and collaboration with technology for economic growth.

title: J&K cloudbursts: At least 46 dead in Kishtwar, floods hit Pahalgam - top developments
content: A devastating cloudburst in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district has claimed at least 12 lives near the Machail Mata temple, prompting a swift response from rescue teams. Simultaneously, heavy rain and flash floods have wreaked havoc in Himachal Pradesh, disrupting infrastructure and isolating villages.

title: 'People don't understand ...': India pacer weighs in on Bumrah's workload call
content: Bhuvneshwar Kumar defended the decision to manage Jasprit Bumrah's workload, emphasising the physical and mental toll of playing all formats. Kumar highlighted Bumrah's significant impact even in a limited number of matches, citing his crucial contribution of 14 wickets in three Tests against England. He also noted Bumrah's increased confidence and maturity gained through years of consistent performance.

title: Audi employees in Germany to the company: Cannot build a factory in America without ...
content: Audi's plan to establish a U.S. plant faces hurdles as labor leaders prioritize securing German jobs amidst President Trump's tariffs. The labor official, Jörg Schlagbauer, insists on long-term guarantees for German production before supporting U.S. expansion. Trump's tariffs, impacting European carmakers, prompt Audi to consider U.S.

title: Top 5 ent news: Dhanush reviews Coolie; Shilpa Shetty-Raj Kundra booked in fraud case
content: Dhanush reviewed Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' with Aishwaryaa, while Varun Badola suggested Shah Rukh Khan couldn't save 'Saiyaara'. Shilpa Shirodkar's car was hit by a bus, and Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra face fraud allegations. Nikhil Dwivedi criticized Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai starrer 'Raavan' for its flawed storytelling and wasted potential, despite its visual appeal.

title: 'Resolve to buy Indian products': Prez Murmu's message to nation amid Trump's tariffs
content: President Droupadi Murmu addressed the nation on the eve of the 79th Independence Day, highlighting India's journey towards self-reliance and confident progress. She emphasized the importance of democracy, the Constitution, and remembering the pain of partition. Murmu also underscored the core values of justice, liberty, equality, and fraternity, while noting the government's efforts to improve urban infrastructure.

title: 'Things are different now': India pacer on how Virat Kohli has changed over the years
content: Bhuvneshwar Kumar reflects on his evolving relationship with Virat Kohli, noting a shift from playful banter to discussions about family and life beyond cricket. Despite their off-field camaraderie, professionalism drives their performance on the field. Bhuvneshwar also praised Rajat Patidar's leadership and RCB's balanced team effort in securing their historic IPL 2025 victory.

title: PPI spike: US producer prices inflation hit 3-year high in July
content: US producer price inflation soared in July, reaching its highest level since 2022, fueled by rising service and goods costs. Economists suggest that President Trump's tariffs are contributing to increased business expenses, particularly in sectors like steel, aluminum and food products.

title: Op Sindoor: Experts back IAF claim of 5 Pak jets downed; hail 300km S-400 hit
content: International analysts corroborate Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh's claims regarding Operation Sindoor, confirming the IAF's downing of multiple Pakistani jets, including a Saab 2000 early warning aircraft. Expert Tom Cooper highlights the S-400 missile system's successful strike at 300 km, a potential world record.

title: 92 all out! Ex-Pak cricketer slams Mike Hesson — 'I don’t know what qualities…'
content: Shoaib Akhtar has criticized Mike Hesson's appointment as Pakistan's head coach after their dismal batting performance against West Indies. Akhtar questioned Hesson's ODI credentials and blamed poor policies for exposing players on seaming tracks. He also urged Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan to take more responsibility in finishing games, emphasizing the need for acceleration after reaching a half-century.

title: 8-0 in ODI WC, 7-1 in T20 WC — But what's India's record vs Pakistan in Asia Cup?
content: India dominated Pakistan in both ICC World Cups and Asia Cups, holding a significant lead in head-to-head records. Out of 18 Asia Cup clashes, India has won 10 compared to Pakistan's 6, securing eight titles against Pakistan's two. This year's Asia Cup, hosted in the UAE, will feature another high-stakes encounter between the two rivals.

title: 'Painful consequences': India warns Pak to 'temper rhetoric'; 'hiding own failures'
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has strongly condemned Pakistan's escalating anti-India rhetoric, warning of severe repercussions for any miscalculated actions. This response follows inflammatory statements by Pakistan's army chief, Asim Munir, including threats against India's Jamnagar refinery. India has voiced concerns regarding the absence of civilian control over Pakistan's nuclear decisions, highlighting the military's collaboration with terrorist groups.

title: Gracie Hunt vs Taylor Swift: Fiery reaction to ‘Showgirl’ look
content: Gracie Hunt, daughter of the Kansas City Chiefs owner, ignited social media with her enthusiastic reaction to Taylor Swift's new album cover, 'The Life of a Showgirl.' The album, set for an October 2025 release, promises a bold, glamorous shift in Swift's musical journey, featuring collaborations with Max Martin, Shellback, and Sabrina Carpenter.

title: Happy Independence Day 2025: Best messages, quotes, wishes and images to share
content: India commemorates its Independence Day on August 15th, marking the end of British rule and the nation's birth in 1947. The day honors freedom fighters like Mahatma Gandhi and Jawaharlal Nehru, who led the struggle for independence. The Prime Minister hoists the national flag at the Red Fort, echoing Nehru's historic act and speech.

title: UPSC CSE main 2025 admit card out; download here for Aug 22 exam
content: The UPSC has released the admit card for the CSE Main 2025 exam scheduled for August 22. Candidates can download their hall tickets from upsc.gov.in using their registration ID and date of birth. It is mandatory to carry the printed admit card and a valid photo ID on exam day. Candidates should verify details carefully and report discrepancies promptly. Multiple copies are advised, and Covid-19 protocols may apply at the exam centres.

title: Vece Paes borrowed Olympic medal from Dhyan Chand’s son after losing his; but final wish went unmet
content: Dr. Vece Paes, the Olympic bronze medalist in hockey, passed away, leaving behind a legacy of sportsmanship and dedication. Despite battling Parkinson's in his later years, he sought to recreate his lost Olympic medal, even borrowing one from a former teammate.

title: LeBron James & Savannah: Untold love story revealed
content: Savannah James, wife of NBA star LeBron James, revealed in a podcast episode that their relationship might not have survived if LeBron hadn't been drafted by the Cleveland Cavaliers. She expressed uncertainty about their future had he not stayed close to home. Despite early challenges, including a teenage pregnancy, the couple persevered and married in 2013.

title: 'Weathered many challenges': India on ties with US ahead of Trump-Putin talks
content: Amidst tariff concerns, the Ministry of External Affairs has expressed confidence in the enduring strength of India-US relations, highlighting their ability to overcome challenges. The 21st edition of the joint military exercise 'Yudh Abhyas' is scheduled for later this month in Alaska, further solidifying defense cooperation.

title: Chaos! Pakistan A openers clashes mid-pitch vs Bangladesh A – Watch
content: During a match between Pakistan A and Bangladesh A at the TIO Stadium in Darwin, openers Mohammad Nafay and Yasir Khan were involved in a heated on-field exchange. A mix-up led to Yasir's run-out, triggering a frustrated outburst where he threw his bat and hurled abuses.

title: 'Shami spends lakhs on mistress' kids': Hasin calls pacer 'womaniser'
content: Hasin Jahan, Mohammed Shami's estranged wife, has publicly accused the cricketer of neglecting their daughter Ayra's education while allegedly prioritizing the schooling of his girlfriend's children. Jahan claims Shami spends lavishly on his girlfriend and her children, including business class flights and elite school admissions, despite receiving Rs 4 lakh monthly alimony, with Rs 2.5 lakh specifically for Ayra's expenses.

title: Is raisin water good for your skin, digestion, or weight loss? Here’s the truth
content: Raisin water, touted as a health elixir by online gurus, faces scrutiny regarding its purported benefits. While whole raisins offer fiber and nutrients, soaking them doesn't effectively transfer these advantages into the water. Claims of weight loss, improved digestion, and enhanced skin health through raisin water lack substantial evidence, suggesting the hype outweighs the actual benefits.

title: Lake Nyos tragedy that killed 1,700 people overnight in Cameroon
content: In 1986, Lake Nyos in Cameroon experienced a devastating limnic eruption, releasing a massive carbon dioxide cloud that killed approximately 1,700 people and 3,500 animals. This rare phenomenon, caused by the sudden release of accumulated CO2, prompted scientific investigation and the implementation of degassing systems to prevent future disasters.

title: Renukaswamy murder case: Actor Darshan arrested after SC cancels bail
content: Kannada film star Darshan Thogudeepa was arrested after the Supreme Court overturned his bail in the Renukaswamy murder case. This followed the arrest of actress Pavithra Gowda, a co-accused. Darshan was apprehended at his wife's residence, reportedly planning to evade arrest. The Supreme Court cited witness intimidation allegations and irregularities in the High Court's bail order.

title: Prithvi Shaw takes first big step after Mumbai exit
content: Ruturaj Gaikwad and Prithvi Shaw have been included in Maharashtra's squad for the All India Buchi Babu Invitational Tournament, scheduled from August 18 to September 9 in Chennai. Ankit Bawane will captain the team.

title: Travis Kelce & Taylor Swift: Flirty ‘New Heights’ moments; fans swoon
content: The New Heights podcast showcased the romance between Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift. Swift revealed 'Red' as her favorite album. Kelce admired her vocabulary. He described being captivated by Swift during her Eras Tour. Kelce expressed his desire to meet her after the show. He praised her stage presence and their easy connection.

title: Rattled by Op Sindoor, Pakistan hastily props up new missile force
content: Following Operation Sindoor, Pakistan is bolstering its military by establishing the Army Rocket Force Command to oversee its missile arsenal. Equipped with modern technology, this force aims to enhance conventional war capabilities. Amidst rising tensions and increased military spending, Pakistan also plans to acquire new fighter jets and air defense systems, while acknowledging support from friendly nations.

title: Rift in SP? MLA Pooja Pal expelled for praising CM Yogi Adityanath
content: The Samajwadi Party expelled MLA Pooja Pal for anti-party activities after she praised Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath. Pal thanked Adityanath for delivering justice in her husband's murder case by eliminating criminals like Atiq Ahmed through policies like zero tolerance.

title: Who is Ravi Ghai? Meet Arjun Tendulkar's future in-law
content: Arjun Tendulkar, son of Sachin Tendulkar, is reportedly engaged to Saaniya Chandok, granddaughter of Mumbai businessman Ravi Ghai. The families have yet to confirm the engagement, which reportedly took place on Wednesday. Saaniya's grandfather, Ravi Ghai, heads the Graviss Group, a prominent hospitality and food-and-beverage company with a 70-year legacy in the industry.

title: Deep ocean mission: Indian aquanauts make record 5,000-metre dive
content: India has achieved a significant milestone with its aquanauts successfully reaching depths exceeding 5,000 metres in the North Atlantic, marking progress in the Deep Ocean Mission. This follows closely after an Indian astronaut's visit to the International Space Station.

title: Electoral rolls show duplicate entries; EC probes LJP MP Veena Devi & husband
content: The Election Commission of India has issued notices to MP Veena Devi and her husband, MLC Dinesh Prasad Singh, following allegations of dual voter registration. Tejashwi Yadav publicly accused them of possessing multiple voter ID cards and being listed in different assembly constituencies. The ECI has initiated a formal inquiry, seeking responses from the couple by August 16, 2025.

title: AC duct treasure: 316 whisky bottles seized after passenger reported cooling issues
content: As Bihar gears up for elections, liquor smuggling intensifies. On the Lucknow-Barauni Express, authorities discovered 316 whisky bottles hidden in an AC duct after a passenger reported cooling issues. A coach attendant from Bihar, Ashish Kumar, was arrested; he confessed to smuggling liquor regularly from Uttar Pradesh to sell in Bihar's black market, exploiting prohibition laws.

title: 'Made huge contribution to cricket': Ratnakar recalls Vece Paes’ role in BCCI
content: Dr. Vece Paes, Olympian and father of Leander Paes, passed away at 80, leaving behind a legacy of contributions to Indian sports. He significantly impacted the BCCI by heading age verification and anti-doping departments, introducing the TW3 method to combat age fraud and launching educational programs featuring cricket icons.
